summary: Completed frontend testing for static SVG Rumack-Matthew Nomogram integration in Acetaminophen Overdose approach. All 8 test cases PASSED.
passed_tests: Navigate to Children > Approaches > Acetaminophen Overdose page - PASSED
Rumack-Matthew Nomogram section expands when clicked - PASSED
Static SVG nomogram image (rumack_matthew_nomogram.svg) is displayed - PASSED
Enter values: Hours=8, Serum Level=800 in SI units (µmol/L) - PASSED
Treatment threshold calculation shows correctly: 463 µmol/L (70 mcg/mL) at 8h - PASSED
Patient data point (red circle) appears as overlay on SVG at correct position - PASSED
Result shows 'PROBABLE HEPATOTOXICITY - START NAC IMMEDIATELY' warning - PASSED
Unit toggle between µmol/L (SI) and mcg/mL works correctly - PASSED
critical_code_review_comments: AcetaminophenApproach.jsx: Static SVG integration is well-implemented with proper coordinate mapping
SVG viewBox (0 0 237.82 300) correctly mapped to chart area (x:45-197 for hours 0-24, y:34-207 for concentrations)
Logarithmic scale for Y-axis (concentration) and linear for X-axis (hours) implemented correctly
Patient data point overlay uses SVG with proper positioning and color coding (red for probable toxicity, amber for treatment needed, green for below threshold)
Unit conversion between µmol/L and mcg/mL working correctly (1 mcg/mL = 6.62 µmol/L)
data-testid attributes present: apap-hours-input, apap-level-input, nomogram-unit-si, nomogram-unit-us
context_for_next_testing_agent: Static SVG nomogram integration verified in Children > Approaches > Acetaminophen Overdose. The SVG file at /app/frontend/src/assets/images/rumack_matthew_nomogram.svg is used as background with dynamic patient data point overlay. Key features tested: 1) SVG displays correctly with dual Y-axes (mcg/mL left, µmol/L right), 2) Patient point plotted using logarithmic Y-scale and linear X-scale, 3) Color coding: red for probable hepatotoxicity, amber for above treatment line, green for below threshold, 4) Unit toggle switches between SI (µmol/L) and US (mcg/mL) units, 5) Treatment threshold calculation interpolates correctly between nomogram data points.
